intro: Zollikoferia quercifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf zollikoferia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, broad, lobed leaves that resemble those of an oak tree, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. Zollikoferia quercifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
